title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act is titled the "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" and it involves the Department of Defense recognizing dependent children of members of the Armed Forces. The Act establishes a lapel button for eligible children of military service members serving on active duty for more than 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will approve the design and establish an application process for eligible members to request the button for their dependents. The Secretary of Defense will establish an application process for eligible members to request a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for their eligible child dependents. Payment of a fee is required for the presentation of the lapel button, with a limitation of one button per eligible child dependent. The presentation of a children of military service members commemorative lapel button requires payment to cover manufacturing and distribution costs. There is a limit of one button per eligible child dependent, but if a person is dependent on multiple members, they may receive a button for each member. If a button is lost or damaged without fault, a replacement may be provided. The children of military service members commemorative lapel button can be replaced if lost or damaged without fault. An eligible child dependent is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations to implement this section uniformly across all armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations to implement this section uniformly across all armed forces, ensuring that dependents of military service members are covered. The Secretary of Defense is urged by Congress to expedite the design, manufacture, and issuance of a commemorative lapel button for children of military service members. Additionally, the button will be made retroactively available to eligible individuals. The Secretary of Defense is required to make available a commemorative lapel button for children of military service members, retroactively accessible to eligible individuals who can prove their status as dependents of Armed Forces members who served on active duty for over 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will provide a mechanism for eligible individuals to apply for a children of military service members commemorative lapel button. Members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, will be notified about the availability of the lapel button. The Secretary of Defense will notify eligible members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, about the children of military service members commemorative lapel button. Applications for the lapel button must be submitted within one year of the announcement of its availability. The children of military service members commemorative lapel button application must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense within one year of the announcement of its availability. Costs, limitations, and exceptions apply to the presentation of the lapel button.
